p: Strong correlation was established between air-dry mass yield and sum of effective temperatures (≥5 °C) (r = 0.86, p < 0.01, n = 75). No correlations were established between the latter indicator and any those of essential oils, except for weak negative correlations with percentages of α-pinene (r = −0.286, p < 0.05, n = 75) and β-pinene (r = −0.252, p < 0.05, n = 75). Additionally, no correlation was established between air-dry mass yield and essential oil percentage during the growing season. Some weak correlations were established between the monthly accumulated precipitation and percentages of α-pinene (r = 0.313, p < 0.01, n = 75) and β-pinene (r = 0.295, p = 0.01, n = 75), of which the former was best pronounced within the habitat No. 1, where α-pinene correlated with precipitation quite strongly (r = 0.525, p < 0.01, n = 25). No correlations were established between the studied Picea abies properties and other weather conditions, such as humidity, pressure, and sunshine duration.
